title: Monitor Hydration Using Urine Color
brief: Use urine color as a reliable indicator of hydration status.
steps: Step 1: Urinate into container or observe color during urination.
Step 2: Compare color to determine hydration status.
Step 3: If urine is light yellow or clear, hydration is adequate.
Step 4: If urine is dark yellow or amber, drink more water immediately.
Step 5: Check urine color at least once every hour during hot weather.
warnings: Dark urine indicates dangerous dehydration levels.
This check should be done regularly, not just when thirsty.
